snippet: After being cleared in Qatar of wrongdoing in the death of their daughter, an American couple was held by immigration officials when trying to depart Doha’s airport.
abstract: Matthew and Grace Huang, American couple in Qatar who spent nearly two years fighting accusations that they killed their adopted daughter from Ghana, are acquitted of wrongdoing; tensions and fear escalate following decision, however, as Qatari immigration officials prevent them from leaving country.

byline.original: By SHABINA S. KHATRI and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Shabina S. Khatri reported from Doha, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: After being cleared in Qatar of wrongdoing in the death of their daughter, an American couple was held by immigration officials when trying to depart Doha’s airport.

headline.main: Qatar Frees U.S. Couple in Death of Daughter
headline.print_headline: Qatar Frees U.S. Couple in Death of Daughter
